helloldap.auth.jwt_tools¶

Tools for handling JSON Web Tokens.

helloldap.auth.jwt_tools.decode_headers(headers, secret)[source]¶

Decodes JWT and returns payload.

Looks for a JWT in header “Authorization”. Raises exceptions if that header is not present or otherwise invalid (e.g. wrong format, expired).

Parameters:
  • headers – Headers of current request
  • secret – Key to decrypt the JWT
Returns:

Dict with payload
Raises:
  • MissingJwtError – if “Authorization” header is not found
  • jwt.exceptions.InvalidTokenError – if the token is otherwise not valid. Exception can also be one of those in jwt.exceptions.
helloldap.auth.jwt_tools.encode(payload, secret, algorithm='HS256', valid_for=datetime.timedelta(0, 600))[source]¶

Encodes the given payload into a JWT.

Sets these reserved claims:

  • ‘iat’: Timestamp when the token is issued, which is now in UTC.
  • ‘nbf’: Same as ‘iat’. The token cannot be valid before it was issued.
  • ‘exp’: The token will expire valid_for seconds after issue time.
Parameters:
  • payload – Dict with public claims.
  • secret – A key to encrypt/decrypt the JWT
  • algorithm – Algorithm to encrypt
  • valid_for – Seconds the token is valid after issue time
Returns:

JWT as string
